english.title: The Coptic Church is the spouse of the Savior
text: The Coptic Church is the spouse of the Savior1
And the light of my Egyptian country.
I will love you, oh Orthodox Church.
The Mother of the martyrs2 is beautiful
The Mother of the righteous is noble
It has crossed a sea of sorrow
And it has preserved the right truth with its blood.
My Mother, your love has given me life
Your pain is the seed of my faith
And I walked out just like the brave did 3
Your enemies beat you and sent you away
They imprisoned you and also killed you
They fed you with food for the beasts
And they pushed you into all sorts of torture
My Mother, how trustworthy were you
Enthralled by the love of your Spouse
His secrets are kept safe by You
And You are safeguarded because of His power.
There is nothing better than my evicted Mother
For the sake of the Servant and his servants
How happy are the ones who give You their hearts,
Who preserve the Church of their ancestor
I wish my heart could love you so much
I could live in the shadow of your Father
I will always chase after you
and I will renew the days of your youth
Oh, my Mother, Your tracks are in the valley
And my heart is burning with Your tenderness
This is the contract of my loyalty and my love
I will serve my ancestors' Church.

arabic.title: علمني
text: و روحك يقودني و كلامك سراج
فحبك اعظم طوق للنجاة ، نبع رجائي
في الصلاة ، كل آمالي في الحياة

english.title: Teach me
text: Teach me, oh Lord, how to wait for You
Let me recognize how to see You along the path
I have no other support other than You
And Your soul guides me, Your words are my beacon
Delight me with Your generous tenderness
And lead me to Your glowing light
For Your love is greater than a life raft, the source of my hope
Is in the prayer, I put all of my faith in my life
My Lord, light up my heart
So that I could see Your arms around me,
Your chest holding me, and You taking care of me

english.title: How long will You forget me, O Lord?
text: How long will You forget me, O Lord?1
The burden of the weight is heavy to me
And it has curved my shoulders
There's no one to help me
And I can't get a warm embrace from anybody.
My soul and body are ill
For the excess of my sorrows
My tongue has stopped moving in my mouth
My tears have become my daily bread
And it dried up my river.
And who can I run to when I'm stressed?
Who will give me my peace back?
